definition: kind of work in production (e.g. benchwork, foundry work etc)

sentences.english: Develop position descriptions for all roles under the control of AHM.
sentences.chinese: 在AHM控制下按为酒店各工种制订职位描述。

sentences.english: Nur is typical of many of the unskilled rural workers who make their way abroad.
sentences.chinese: 诺是众多在国外进行无技术性工种的劳工典型。

sentences.english: Their jobs have been drastically upskilled.
sentences.chinese: 他们工种的技术含量大幅度提高。

sentences.english: There is a specific tool for each job.
sentences.chinese: 各工种配备特定的工具。

sentences.english: Laborers to be engaged in technical work must receive pre-job training before taking up their posts.
sentences.chinese: 从事技术工种的劳动者，上岗前必须经过培训。

sentences.english: Labourers to be engaged in technical work must receive training before taking up their posts.
sentences.chinese: 从事技术工种的劳动者，上岗前必须经过培训。

sentences.english: The jobs have been made redundant by technological advance.
sentences.chinese: 这些职业工种因技术的发展而变得多馀。

sentences.english: Mechanization opens the way for skilled jobs in agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 机械化为农业的技术工种开辟了道路。

sentences.english: The welder is a mature technical type found in all urban and rural areas in China.
sentences.chinese: 电焊工是在中国任何城乡都可以找到的成熟技术工种。

sentences.english: Benchwork is an indispensable machinery manufacturing job.
sentences.chinese: 钳工是机械制造中不可缺少的工种。

sentences.english: Jobs change as a result of new technologies and improved methods.
sentences.chinese: 工种变化是新技术和方法完善的产物。

sentences.english: Results from the analysis examing the moderating effects of job type are provided in Table 2.
sentences.chinese: 表格2呈现的是对于工种的缓冲效应的分析结果。
